page.title: 04Page 3 (continued)
page.content: It took about ten minutes to get to Borthwick. We set off from the graveyard which was just opposite Borthwick castle.We had to walk about one and a half miles over fields,up steep hills and across marshes.I was all muddy and wet when we arrived.At this time of year we would normally have to pay to get into the castle but we were allowed a look at it for free. The whole class couldn't all fit in the mini bus so Michelle,Hazel and I all stayed behind with Mr Ross. I returned home for my dinner and changed my socks and shoes.In the afternoon four people worked with Mr Wright and did some work on the Domesday Project.The bell rang at 3.20pm.It had been an interesting day.
